John later did an excellent cover of “Stand By Me ”

This was derivative of another tune John had hatched around the same time:

An effort at writing It Won’t Be Long – same ilk: C to A minor, C to A minor – with me shouting.

In this song John offers his time, sympathy, and patience. Quite different than his stance in songs like “You Can’t Do That” and “I’ll Cry Instead”, and its certainly contradicts how busy he seems to be in “When I Get Home”

If you’re feeling sorry and sad
 I’d really sympathize

This is either genuine concern… or an excuse to spend some time with a lovely, downtrodden lass.

Interestingly enough, this song was a last minute composition, the Beatles had intended to write lyrics for the middle eight section, but ran out of time. Paul suggested they just use a Piano composition, and the album was released with an unfinished song, simply because they hit their deadline. It certainly didn’t hurt the albums success at all! Ultimately selling over 4,000,000 copies in the United States!
